column4: Hi there! I need help on formatting a usb hard-drive. Right now, it's completely messed up - how to get just one clean ext3 partition (just for regular files)?
Use gparted (it will erase everything on the drive)
so I have deleted everything using gparted. Now I'll create a single new one - primary or extended? (I want to use the usb harddrive for data like a "big usb stick")
Primary.  extended is for adding more than 4 partitions to a hdd
so, /dev/sdb1 is formatted ext3. How can I mount that into some homedirectory and be able to write to it as non-root?
first mount it (the proper place is in /mnt) but you can put it in any empty folder in your /home
right. But doing so sets the permissions to root
Then chown -R you /path/to/that/folder (which makes you the owner of the whole thing
But you will have to mount it every time if you don't but an entry into fstab
wols : thank you both very much!
You should put something in /etc/fstab so that you don't have to mount it everytime
